gbj_pythonlib_hw package¶

Submodules¶

gbj_pythonlib_hw.picomp module¶

Module for common fuctionalities of microcomputers of the class Pi.

Notes

Focused on microcomputers:

  • Orange Pi One
  • Orange Pi Zero
  • Nano Pi Neo
  • Raspberry Pi B
class gbj_pythonlib_hw.picomp.PiComputer[source]¶

Bases: object

Common Pi computers management.

  • All temperature values are expressed in float centigrades, i.e., degrees of Celsius.
  • The microprocesor’s temperature sensor provides temperature resolution in millicentigrades, which is hardly the same measurement accuracy.
convert_percentage_temperature(percentage)[source]¶

Convert percentage of limit to temperature.

Parameters:percentage (float) – System temperature expressed in percentage of temperature limit of the system.
Returns:temperature – System temperature in degrees of Celsius. If some problem occurs with convertion, the None is provided.
Return type:float
convert_temperature_percentage(temperature)[source]¶

Convert temperature to percentage of limit.

Parameters:temperature (float) – System temperature in degrees of Celsius.
Returns:percentage – System temperature expressed in percentage of temperature limit of the system. If some problem occurs with convertion, the None is provided.
Return type:float
get_temperature()[source]¶

Return recently measured CPU temperature.

Returns:centigrades – Recently measured system temperature in degrees of Celsius. Useful for repeating calling with ensured same value.
Return type:float
get_temperature_limit()[source]¶

Return CPU temperature limit.

Returns:centigrades – Current system temperature limit in degrees of Celsius.
Return type:float
get_temperature_percentage()[source]¶

Return recently measured CPU temperature percentage of limit.

Returns:percentage – Recently measured system temperature expressed in percentage of temperature limit of a system. Useful for repeating calling with ensured same value.
Return type:float
measure_temperature()[source]¶

Measure CPU temperature.

Returns:centigrades – Current system temperature in degrees of Celsius. If some problem occurs with reading system file, the None is provided.
Return type:float
measure_temperature_percentage()[source]¶

Return CPU temperature percentage of limit.

Returns:percentage – Current system temperature expressed in percentage of temperature limit of the system. If some problem occurs with reading system file, the None is provided.
Return type:float

gbj_pythonlib_hw.orangepi module¶

Module for controlling GPIOs of Orange Pi microcomputers.

  • The library orangepi_PC_gpio_pyH3 should be installed: https://github.com/duxingkei33/orangepi_PC_gpio_pyH3
  • For controlling in-built LEDs their control at the operating system level should be set to None.
class gbj_pythonlib_hw.orangepi.OrangePiOne[source]¶

Bases: gbj_pythonlib_hw.picomp.PiComputer

Creating a GPIO manager for microcomputer Orange Pi One.

Notes

  • GPIO pins including system LEDs are identified for the sake of this class by name of its attributes defined in the library.

  • Each pin can be named in the form as a port or as a connector. Each form has its own list of available pin names, which can be obtained with commands:

    dir(port)
dir(connector)

  • List of available ports for GPIO pins: PA0, PA1, PA10, PA11, PA12, PA13, PA14, PA18, PA19, PA2, PA20, PA21, PA3, PA6, PA7, PA8, PA9, PC0, PC1, PC2, PC3, PC4, PC7, PD14, PG6, PG7, PG8, PG9

  • List of available ports for system LEDS: POWER_LED, STATUS_LED

  • List of available connectors for GPIO pins: gpio1p10, gpio1p11, gpio1p12, gpio1p13, gpio1p15, gpio1p16, gpio1p18, gpio1p19, gpio1p21, gpio1p22, gpio1p23, gpio1p24, gpio1p26, gpio1p27, gpio1p28, gpio1p29, gpio1p3, gpio1p31, gpio1p32, gpio1p33, gpio1p35, gpio1p36, gpio1p37, gpio1p38, gpio1p40, gpio1p5, gpio1p7, gpio1p8

  • List of available connectors for system LEDS: LEDp1, LEDp2

is_pin_input(pin)[source]¶

Return flag about pin mode INPUT.

See also

is_pin_on()
Arguments, Returns, Raises are the same, see docstrings.
is_pin_off(pin)[source]¶

Return flag about pin state LOW.

See also

is_pin_on()
Arguments, Returns, Raises are the same, see docstrings.
is_pin_on(pin)[source]¶

Return flag about pin state HIGH.

Parameters:pin (str) – Name of a pin in form either port or connector. The argument is mandatory and has no default value.
Returns:flag_high – Logical flag about pin state HIGH. True if HIGH or False for LOW.
Return type:bool
Raises:NameError – Pin name is defined neither among ports nor connectors. Error message included to the exception.
is_pin_output(pin)[source]¶

Return flag about pin mode OUTPUT.

See also

is_pin_on()
Arguments, Returns, Raises are the same, see docstrings.
pin_off(pin)[source]¶

Set pin as OUTPUT and to LOW.

See also

pin_on()
Arguments, Raises are the same, see docstrings.
pin_on(pin)[source]¶

Set pin as OUTPUT and to HIGH.

Parameters:pin (str) – Name of a pin in form either port or connector. The argument is mandatory and has no default value.
Raises:NameError – Pin name is defined neither among ports nor connectors. Error message included to the exception.

pin_read(pin, mode=0)[source]¶

Set pin as INTPUT and read its state.

Returns:pin_state – Current state of the pin.
Return type:{gpio.HIGH, gpio.LOW}

See also

pin_on()
Arguments, Raises are the same, see docstrings.

Return pin state without changing it mode.

Returns:pin_state – Current state of the pin.
Return type:{gpio.HIGH, gpio.LOW}

See also

pin_on()
Arguments, Raises are the same, see docstrings.
